item.title: Setup Chutzpah to Run Javascript Tests in VisualStudio
item.description: First thing first, install Chutzpah Test Runner and Test Adaptor for the Test Explorer. Next, setup your projects in Visual Studio. I personally like to keep my test code in a separate project for JavaScript as well so my project and folder structure looks like this: This allows you to restrict testing frameworks and libraries like Jasmine only to the test project. I use JavaScript libraries directly from the main project when it is needed in test projects as well rather then adding them again in the test project (some people have different view on this but it works for me).
